talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: I did 100 days of duolingo and 100 days of the immersion method (listening, reading, flashcards app) and the difference in how much I learned was wild!! After 100 days of the immersion method I went back to duolingo and was able to skip past several sections!!! It's just better üëå never going back

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: I noticed when going back to duolingo just how inefficient it is. After every answer there are pauses, extra clicks, decoration and lingering on each correct response you give. It got frustrating after becoming used to my SRS app!!! I just wanna LEARN, thanks üò≠

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: AND THATS ON TOP OF THE AI SLOP... where there's smoke there's fire DOWNLOAD ANKI

talk.author: did:plc:mmtknhnesvfmo6pqdqb7gdku

anki works sooooo well for so many things
whats your routine btw

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
Daily
‚Ä¢ 10 new flashcards (minimum)
‚Ä¢ 1 Kanji lesson from kanji app
‚Ä¢ At least one written article on todaii
‚Ä¢ Pop online and read japanese bsky posts
‚Ä¢ Listen to spoken japanese while drawing/driving/exercising 

Eventually I wanna start talking on VRchat!!

What's your routine??

talk.author: did:plc:mmtknhnesvfmo6pqdqb7gdku
talk.utter:
ohh, I might steal the todaii thing at some point, seems great!!
I also do 10-15 new flashcards daily (from JLab's beginner deck, it's awesome), and WaniKani+Bunpro on the side for kanji and example sentences.
VRChat is also the end goal but it looks so far away... For now am happy my lil reviews

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
Do you do any listening?!! I think that's a huge part in getting ready for speech on VRchat!! 

I've never heard of WaniKani... i'm gunna go check it out üëÄ

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
Do you do any listening?!! I think that's a huge part in getting ready for speech on VRchat!!

talk.author: did:plc:mmtknhnesvfmo6pqdqb7gdku
talk.utter:
Apart from audio-only Anki cards, not really... I was waiting to have some more vocabulary but perhaps I should start now!

WaniKani works pretty well for me, they teach radicals, kanji + common readings, and some vocabulary, all with mnemonics. It's made by Tofugu, perhaps u know them/their style

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
omg I'm going to give it a go. That sounds so good. Thank you!!

Okay, oh my god, I seriously think listening would supercharge you!!!! You won't understand most of it at first but that is FINE, it takes ages, but your brain will really get a feel for everything as you learn, it's so good

talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
Is it ok if I ask about what the "listen to spoken japanese" is??

Bc I want to do more listening but I don't really know where to start

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: You can start with anything you like really!!! Your fave games, movies, anime, shows in japanese are good. You probably won't understand a lot of it or any of it at first but that is FINE and NORMAL üôè It made me think back to when I was a tiny baby and didn't understand english yet

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: You can start with anything you like really!!! Your fave games, movies, anime, shows in japanese are good. You probably won't understand a lot of it or any of it at first but that is FINE and NORMAL üôè It made me think back to when I was a tiny baby and didn't understand english yet

talk.author: did:plc:depsg2otv7nbo2ca2z5iqopi
talk.utter:
When watching for listening should I watch without subs?? 

Because I tried watching anime that I like and was very hit or miss, maybe bc it was a little too hard haha 

But once I tried watching Blue Box with japanese subs and it was great. Also first time seeing, but I only saw one episode

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter:
Personally I think yeah, without subs. It'll be really hard to understand at first, for like months to a year, but if you do it every day your brain will pick up on it like how it did your native language!!! 

EEE YES good it's awesome you've found something you're enjoying this way!!!!!!

talk.author: did:plc:knkltoiapkt336rr335ztt3p
talk.utter: AS IN WITHOUT ENGLISH SUBS. I THINK JAPANESE SUBS ARE GOOD
